content: In the Harry Potter series, what magical artifact allows its possessor to become invisible when worn?

In the Harry Potter series, the magical artifact that allows its possessor to become invisible when worn is called the Cloak of Invisibility. This cloak is one of the three Deathly Hallows, which also include the Elder Wand and the Resurrection Stone. The Cloak of Invisibility is particularly significant because it has the power to make the wearer completely invisible, without any limitations or drawbacks, unlike other invisibility cloaks which may have flaws or wear out over time. The cloak plays a crucial role in the series, especially in the later books, as Harry Potter and his friends use it to navigate through dangerous situations and uncover important secrets.
